usecase_title: AI-Based Mapping of Piezometers to Appropriate Villages Based on Aquifer Nature/Behavior for Preparation of Village-Level Ground Water Recharge Plans
usecase_description:
AI-Based Mapping and Forecasting of Groundwater Levels Using Piezometer Data

Developing an AI-driven solution for village-level groundwater mapping, forecasting, and recharge planning using existing piezometer data and aquifer characteristics.

Theme AI for Water Resource Management

Department Andhra Pradesh Ground Water and Water Audit Department

Challenge Teaser

Help Andhra Pradesh safeguard its groundwater resources with AI! Build a system that predicts water levels, identifies recharge needs, and maps aquifer behavior across villages using intelligent analytics.

Challenge Overview

Groundwater supports nearly 80% of drinking water needs and 60% of agricultural irrigation in Andhra Pradesh. However, decades of over-extraction and unregulated borewell drilling have caused alarming depletion trends. Average groundwater depths have fallen from 4–6 meters in the 1980s to around 12 meters today, with 56% of wells showing declining levels.

The Ground Water and Water Audit Department maintains a network of about 1,800 digital water level recorders (piezometers) but lacks AI-enabled forecasting, anomaly detection, and integration with GIS-based planning. This challenge seeks to enhance the existing system using AI and IoT technologies for predictive groundwater management and recharge planning.

Expected Solution

Participants are invited to develop an AI-enabled groundwater monitoring and forecasting model integrated with the existing piezometer network.

Key solution features should include:

  • AI-Based Groundwater Level Mapping: Assign groundwater level values to villages without piezometers using data from existing sensors and aquifer characteristics.
  • Forecasting and Trend Analysis: Predict groundwater depletion using rainfall, extraction rates, and seasonal trends from 1,800+ piezometers.
  • Anomaly Detection: Identify abnormal groundwater variations or borewell yield changes with at least 90% precision.
  • Recharge Planning: Recommend zones for artificial recharge by identifying critical depletion and protection areas.
  • Integration and Visualization: Provide real-time outputs via APIs and dashboards for engineers, scientists, and field officers.

Outcomes

  • Real-time, actionable groundwater insights for department officials and engineers.
  • Improved efficiency in monitoring and forecasting groundwater trends.
  • Direct farmer-level advisories reducing stress and improving recharge efforts.
  • Optimized groundwater monitoring and resource management across the state.

Expected Impact

  • Sustainability Enables data-driven groundwater budgeting, recharge planning, and drought management.
  • Equity & Inclusion Provides early warnings and decision support for farmers and local administrators.
  • Policy Alignment Supports National and State Water Policy objectives by enabling enforcement of groundwater protection zones.

Dataset Access

  • Piezometer and well IDs with GPS coordinates.
  • Historical and real-time groundwater level data.
  • Aquifer and geological maps with stratification details.
  • Rainfall and climate data for temporal correlation.
  • Land-use, recharge structure, irrigation, and extraction datasets for training AI models.

Proof of Concept (PoC) Scope

The proof-of-concept should be conducted in Krishna District, focusing on a subset of approximately 150 priority piezometers. User testing to include groundwater scientists (15) and district officials (8).

Proof of Concept (PoC) Success Criteria

  • At least 70% positive feedback from user testing by department scientists and district officials.
  • Demonstrated integration with dashboards and API-based data services.

Data Privacy and Compliance

Solutions must adhere to data privacy and security norms for hydrological and geospatial data. Any village-level or farmer-related data must be anonymized. The system must ensure explainable and transparent AI outputs for validation and audit purposes.
